item.description:
一、John Logie Baird 大事记

1.1 生卒年

  • 1888.8.13 - 1946.6.14，享年58岁

1.2 文聘

  • Larchfield Academy, the Royal Technical College, and the University of Glasgow,

1.3 成就

1924 电视转播对象的轮廓图

  • Televised Objects in Outline

1925 传输第一个可识别的人脸

  • transmitted recognizable human faces

1926(1.26) 在伦敦皇家研究院演示了移动物体的电视转播

  • demonstrating the televising of moving objects in Royal Institution, London

1928 发明了世界上第一台彩色电视

  • Inventing the first colour television in 1928

1929 在德国邮局帮助下造出第一台电视装置

1936年，BBC开始电视转播，1937年，BBC购买了他的竞争者的电视系统,抛弃了他(悲)

1946 造出立体电视

  • Build a stereoscopic television

二、Wikipedia的资料

2.1 出身

  1. 生于Helensburgh, Dunbartonshire,排行老四(老小)

  2. 父亲是the Church of Scotland’s minister for the local St Bride’s Church(苏格兰教会当地圣新娘教堂的牧师)

  3. 母亲是the orphaned niece of a wealthy family of shipbuilders from Glasgow(格拉斯哥造船业富裕家庭的孤侄女)

2.2 学历

  1. Larchfield Academy

  2. the Glasgow and West of Scotland Technical College

  3. the University of Glasgow

2.3 经历

2.3.1 学校生活

  1. 刻苦钻研工程课程，把身体累垮了(ill health)

  2. 成为了社会主义者，不可知论者(agnostic)

  3. 学业因第一次世界大战终止,终究没能毕业

  4. 1915年进入英国军队(British Army)，进行自愿(Volunteer)工作，被判定为不适合现役(unfit for active duty),没去前线。

  5. 之后去了家电力公司，研究弹药

2.3.2 电视研究

  1. 1923年,搬到Linton Crescent, Hastings(英格兰南部海岸),租了个作坊(workshop),造了世界上第一台工作电视机(Working Television Set)

  2. 1924年2月,他向一家报刊证实了semi-mechanical analogue television system的可行性

  3. 1924年7月，遭1000V电击幸存，无大碍，被房东赶走

  4. 不久搬到伦敦,向新闻报刊宣传他的成果，大家都不相信，觉得他是疯子

  5. 他使用the Nipkow disk进行试验，这一设备同样被很多人用来研究broadcast medium

  6. 1924年6月购买了一种电池(cell),他通过优化电池的信号、温度调节以及自己定制的视频放大器产生了实时、可移动的灰度画面,这是其他发明家所没有完成的[23]

  7. 1925年3月25日开始通过电视公开展示移动剪影图像[24]

  8. 1925年10月2日，他成功传输了带有灰度图像(greyscale image)的电视画面和人脸[21][22]

  9. 1926年1月26日，首次向皇家学会成员和记者展示真实电视图像[5]

  10. 1928年7月3日，向世界展示了首个彩色电视图像[28][29]

2.3.3 广播

  1. 1927年5月，在伦敦向438英里外的格拉斯哥长距离转播电视画面[31],这是对贝尔实验室225英里长距离传输的挑战[32]

  2. 1928年和1929年11月，分别在英国和法国建立了电视公司(法国的公司是和Bernard Natan合伙开的)[33]

  3. 1936年，贝尔德的电视设备在南伦敦的水晶宫(Crystal Palace)中引起了大火,审判持续了6个月

  4. 1937年2月, Baird电视系统被BBC抛弃，原因是

  • the lack of mobility of the Baird system’s cameras, with their developer tanks, hoses, and cables.[41]

  • 取而代之的是EMI Marconi公司的 first fully electronic television system[42]

2.3.4 晚年

  1. 自1944年12月起，一直住在1 Station Road, Bexhill-on-Sea, East Sussex,2007年被拆除[53]

  2. 1946年2月中风，6月14日去世[53]

  3. 与父母葬在一起[54]

2.4 其他发明

  1. 二十余岁尝试通过加热石墨制造钻石,失败[15]

  2. 玻璃剃须刀(glass razor), 但易碎[15]

  3. 充气鞋(pneumatic shoes),失败。但他的这一想法被Dr.Martens在多年后实现了[15]

  4. 保暖袜 thermal undersock (the Baird undersock),取得一定成功。他本人有脚冷症(Cold Feet),这对他有一定用处[15]

演讲稿

Good afternoon, everyone:

Today, I’d like to talk to you about John Logie Baird, Someone calls him the Father of television. I’m Downey, and this is my partner Larry.

As a pioneer in the field of electronics and electrical engineering. Baird is widely recognized for his work in inventing the world’s first television system, which revolutionized the entertainment industry and transformed how we communicate.

It’s important to recognize that Baird was not solely responsible for his achievements. He built upon the work of others, such as Paul Nipkow’s invention of the Nipkow disk, which allowed for the scanning of images. However, Baird was able to improve upon this technology and create a working television system.

It’s likely that someone else would have eventually made similar developments or discoveries, as advancements in technology were rapidly evolving during this time. However, Baird’s ingenuity and persistence in pushing the boundaries of technology were instrumental in making his television system a reality.

Baird’s early family life did not have a significant impact on his achievements. He was born into a modest family and faced financial challenges throughout his life. However, this did not deter him from pursuing his passion for electronics and engineering.

If sth. has the greatest influence on how Baird achieved his dream. I would say, that’s the formal education he received in physics, engineering, and electrical science. He attended the Glasgow and West of Scotland Technical College, where he studied electrical engineering. This foundation allowed him to understand the underlying principles of electronics and develop new technologies.

Of course, financial support also played a critical role in his success. He received funding from various sources, including the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC), which allowed him to continue his research and development. Without this financial support, Baird may not have been able to bring his television system to fruition.

Such is John Logie Baird. A visionary inventor who was also an exceptional individual who made significant contributions to the field of electronics and electrical engineering.

Though facing difficulties along the way, he has never been beaten. And the great influence they have on other people, the field of communication, and other people are yet to be presented.

Larry.

item.title: Presentation
item.description:
题目要求

一、主题

What can be learned from a notable figure in the history of electronics or electrical engineering

二、长度

  1. 8分钟PPT
  2. 2分钟Q&A

三、PPT 要求！！

  1. 所有的图片标注为image1、…image n
  2. 开头加上参与者拼音名
  3. 倒数第二张必须是图片来源
  4. 最后一张必须是Reference
  5. 所有的source必须是IEEE style
  6. 名称是Pres_slides_Stuednt1SurnameGivenname_Student2SurnameGivenname

四、PPT内容I(Partner 1)

  1. 有Introduction和conclusion
  2. 必须着重讲他们在Electrical & Electronic Engineering的贡献,而不是其他领域的贡献;不能只写生活和贡献
  3. 我们能从他们的贡献和经历(成功道路)中学习什么(不是必选)

  • 他们多大程度上单独完成了他们的成就

  • 其他人有多大可能做出相同贡献

  • 他们的早期家庭生活多大程度上影响了他们的成功

  • 他们接受的基础科学教育多大程度上影响了他们的成功

  • 经济援助多大程度上上影响了他们的成功

五、PPT内容II(Partner II)

  • 他们具有什么样的精神品质促成了他们的伟大成就；他们遇到了什么困难，面对困难时，他们展示了什么样的精神品质

  • 只有他们的成就才能促成的发明、发现有哪些；他们的伟大成就有什么积极的和消极的长期影响

  • 他们如何激励了其他人在该领域的工作

  • 我们能学习什么

六、Sources

  1. 必须paraphrase
  2. 来源
  • UoG Library
  • IEEE Xplore
  • UESTC Library 中的英语教科书
  • other English Website(不准用百度)
  1. 若果用Britannica Academic，必须用以下格式引用
  • (作者),文章名，in Britannica Academic,地名:期刊名,年份,Accessed:时间. [Online]. Available:网址
  1. 不准使用
  • 普通网站
  • 新闻媒体
  • 社交媒体网站
  • 公司网站
  • 会议论文
  1. 搜索建议
  • 使用全名搜索
  • 搜索他们的成就

七、其他

  1. 可以带打印的笔记

  2. 记得录视频

  3. 不准用电子产品记笔记
